sources.title: City Without Men
sources.description: A young woman's husband has been imprisoned for a crime he didn't commit. In order to be near him to try to help him get his sentence overturned, she moves into a boardinghouse near the prison whose residents are the wives of inmates.

sources.title: City without Men (1943) [Drama]
sources.description:
A young woman's husband has been imprisoned for a crime he didn't commit. In order to be near him to try to help him get his sentence overturned, she moves into a boardinghouse near the prison whose residents are the wives of inmates.

---

Directed by Sidney Salkow, produced bySamuel Bronston (executive producer) and B.P. Schulberg (producer), written by Martin Berkeley (story), Donald Davis (additional dialogue), W.L. River (screenplay), Budd Schulberg (story) and George Sklar (additional dialogue), starring Linda Darnell as Nancy Johnson, Edgar Buchanan as Michael T. Mallory, Michael Duane as Tom Adams, Sara Allgood as Maria Barton, Glenda Farrell as Billie LaRue, Leslie Brooks as Gwen, Doris Dudley as Winnie, Margaret Hamilton as Dora, Constance Worth as Elsie, Rosemary DeCamp as Mrs. Slade and Sheldon Leonard as Monk LaRue. 

---

Source: "City without Men" iMDb, The Internet Movie Database, IMDb.com, Inc., 5 May 2013. Web. 05 May 2013. http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0035740/?ref_=fn_al_tt_1.

If you like this movie and our channel, please subscribe: https://goo.gl/0qDmXe

sources.title: City Without Men (1943)
sources.description: City Without Men (1943) PD - Copyright not renewed

sources.title: City Without Men (1943) LINDA DARNELL
sources.description:
Stars: Linda Darnell, Edgar Buchanan, Michael Duane
 Director: Sidney Salkow

 A young woman's husband has been imprisoned for a crime he didn't commit. In order to be near him to try to help him get his sentence overturned, she moves into a boardinghouse near the prison where all the residents are the wives of inmates! YIKES!

metadata.Plot: A young woman's husband has been imprisoned for a crime he didn't commit. In order to be near him to try to help him get his sentence overturned, she moves into a boardinghouse near the prison whose residents are the wives of inmates.
